seller_research.name: Whatfix
seller_research.description: Whatfix is a digital adoption platform that provides enterprises with a no-code editor to create in-app guidance on any application that looks 100% native.

pricing_models.description: Whatfix pricing is based on two components: a flat per-application fee, plus user license fees.
pricing_models.price: Customized, based on application and users

pricing_models.description: Starting at $39 per month, suitable for small-scale use

buyer_research.name: Marketboomer
buyer_research.description: A cloud-based digital procurement software company serving the hospitality industry
goals: Optimize purchasing, invoicing, and inventory management

pains: How can Whatfix help us streamline our hospitality procurement process?
Will Whatfix be able to integrate with our existing procurement software?
How can we measure the ROI of implementing Whatfix?
Will Whatfix be able to provide real-time analytics and insights for our procurement process?
How does Whatfix handle complex procurement processes like ours?
Can Whatfix provide a customized solution for our specific industry needs?
How does Whatfix handle user adoption and onboarding?
Can Whatfix help us improve supplier relationships?
objections: Whatfix seems expensive, can you provide a more cost-effective solution?
We've had bad experiences with digital adoption platforms in the past, how is Whatfix different?
We're not sure if Whatfix can handle our large-scale procurement process
Whatfix's implementation process seems complicated, can you simplify it?
We're worried about data security and compliance with Whatfix
Whatfix's user interface seems cluttered, can you make it more user-friendly?
Can Whatfix provide references or case studies from similar companies in the hospitality industry?

messages.content: Hi, thank you for taking the time to speak with me today! I'm excited to learn more about Marketboomer and how Whatfix can help you streamline your hospitality procurement process. Can you start by telling me a bit about your current procurement process and what challenges you're facing?

Hi! Yeah, our current process is quite manual and time-consuming. We have multiple stakeholders involved, including hotel managers, procurement managers, and suppliers. We're looking for a way to optimize our purchasing, invoicing, and inventory management. We've been struggling with complex procurement processes and inefficient purchasing and invoicing.

I understand. It sounds like you're looking for a digital solution to automate and streamline your procurement process. Can you tell me more about what you mean by complex procurement processes? Are there any specific pain points or areas where you're losing time or efficiency?

Well, we have multiple hotels and each one has its own procurement process. We're using different software for each hotel, which makes it difficult to get a unified view of our procurement. We're also struggling to keep track of inventory levels and supplier relationships. And on top of that, our procurement managers are wasting too much time on manual tasks like data entry and reporting.

I see. It sounds like you're looking for a solution that can provide a centralized platform for your procurement process, and also automate some of the manual tasks. Have you considered using a digital adoption platform like Whatfix to help streamline your procurement process and improve user adoption?
Actually, we've been looking at a few different options, including WalkMe and Pendo. But we're interested in learning more about Whatfix and how it can help us achieve our goals.

Great! Whatfix is a digital adoption platform that can help you achieve your goals by providing in-app guidance, product analytics, and user onboarding. We've worked with similar companies in the hospitality industry and have seen significant improvements in user adoption and efficiency. Can I show you a quick demo of our platform and how it can be customized to meet your specific needs?
Yeah, that would be great. We're interested in seeing how Whatfix can help us improve our procurement process and reduce inefficiencies.

Okay, let me just share my screen real quick... (demo of Whatfix platform). As you can see, our platform provides a no-code editor to create in-app guidance on any application. We can customize the platform to meet your specific industry needs and provide real-time analytics and insights for your procurement process.
That looks really interesting. How does Whatfix handle complex procurement processes like ours? And can you provide a customized solution for our specific industry needs?

Yes, Whatfix is designed to handle complex procurement processes like yours. We can provide a customized solution that meets your specific industry needs. We've worked with similar companies in the hospitality industry and have developed a deep understanding of their procurement processes. We can also provide references or case studies from similar companies if you're interested.
That's great to hear. What kind of ROI can we expect from implementing Whatfix? And how will we be able to measure the success of the implementation?

We've seen our customers achieve significant ROI from implementing Whatfix. On average, our customers see a 30% reduction in training time, a 25% increase in user adoption, and a 20% increase in productivity. We can work with you to develop a customized implementation plan that meets your specific needs and provides measurable success indicators.
Okay, that sounds great. What are the next steps for implementing Whatfix?

The next steps would be to discuss the implementation plan in more detail, including timelines, budget, and resources required. We can also provide a customized quote based on your specific needs. Would you like to schedule a follow-up call to discuss further?

pain_points: difficulty in getting a unified view of procurement
manual tasks like data entry and reporting

features.name: In-app Guidance
features.description: Provides personalized, contextual guidance to users within the application, enabling them to complete tasks efficiently.

features.name: Digital Adoption Platform
features.description: Offers a no-code editor to create in-app guidance on any application, ensuring 100% native look and feel.

features.name: Product Analytics
features.description: Delivers insights into user behavior, helping businesses to identify areas of improvement and optimize their application.

features.name: User Onboarding
features.description: Streamlines the onboarding process with interactive tutorials, reducing the time and effort required to get users up and running.

features.name: Performance Support
features.description: Provides users with the necessary support and guidance to complete tasks efficiently, reducing the need for manual support and training.

messages.content: Hello everyone, thank you for taking the time to join today's demo call. I'm excited to show you how Whatfix can help address the pain points you're experiencing with your procurement process. Before we begin, I just want to confirm that we have all the stakeholders on the call, including hotel managers, procurement managers, and suppliers and vendors. Is that correct?

Yes, that's correct. We're all here. We're looking for a solution to simplify our procurement process and improve user adoption. We're currently using different software for each hotel, which is causing inefficiencies and making it difficult to get a unified view of our procurement process.

I understand. Our Digital Adoption Platform can help streamline your procurement process by providing a centralized platform for all your procurement needs. With our In-app Guidance feature, we can provide personalized, contextual guidance to users within the application, enabling them to complete tasks efficiently. Would you like me to demonstrate how this works?
Yes, please.

Okay. (demonstration of In-app Guidance feature) As you can see, our platform provides step-by-step guidance to users, eliminating the need for manual support and training. We've seen significant improvements in user adoption and productivity with our clients in the hospitality industry.
That looks impressive. But how will this integrate with our existing systems?

We've designed our platform to integrate seamlessly with your existing systems. Our Product Analytics feature can deliver insights into user behavior, helping you identify areas of improvement and optimize your application. We've had success with similar integrations with our clients, such as XYZ Hotels, who saw a 30% reduction in training time and a 25% increase in user productivity.
I'm not sure if this will work for our unique procurement process. Can you customize the platform to fit our specific needs?

Absolutely. We understand that every business is unique, and we offer customized solutions to fit your specific needs. We can work with you to develop a tailored solution that addresses your complex procurement processes and inefficient purchasing and invoicing. We've done this with other clients in the hospitality industry, and I'm confident we can do the same for you.
Okay, that sounds good. What kind of ROI can we expect from implementing Whatfix?

We've seen our clients achieve significant ROI from implementing our platform. On average, our clients see a 3-6 month payback period on their investment. We can work with you to develop a customized ROI analysis that takes into account your specific business needs and goals.

Before we conclude the demo, I just want to summarize the key takeaways from today's call. We've demonstrated how our Digital Adoption Platform can help streamline your procurement process, improve user adoption, and reduce training time. We've also discussed how our platform can be customized to fit your specific needs, and the ROI you can expect from implementing Whatfix. Do you have any final questions before we wrap up?
No, I think that covers everything. Thank you for the demo.

You're welcome. We'll follow up with a summary of today's demo and answer any additional questions you may have. Our next steps will be to discuss the customized solution and ROI analysis in more detail. Thank you again for your time, and we look forward to working with you.

messages.content: Hi everyone, thank you for taking the time to discuss the pricing for Whatfix. I'm excited to walk you through our pricing models and answer any questions you may have.
Thank you for the demo last week. We're impressed with the features and functionality of Whatfix. Can you please walk us through your pricing models?

Absolutely. We have three pricing models to choose from. Our Flat Fee + User License Fees model is customized based on the application and users. We also offer a Free Plan with 30 credits, suitable for small-scale use, and a Basic Plan starting at $39 per month. Which one of these models sounds most appealing to you?
We're interested in the Flat Fee + User License Fees model. Can you explain it in more detail?

The Flat Fee + User License Fees model is designed to provide a flexible and scalable pricing solution for our customers. The flat fee is based on the application, and the user license fees are based on the number of users. This model allows you to only pay for what you need, and scale up or down as your business requires.
That sounds reasonable. How will this integrate with our existing systems?

We've designed our platform to integrate seamlessly with your existing systems. We've worked with numerous customers in the hospitality industry, and our integration process is smooth and efficient. We'll work closely with your IT team to ensure a successful integration.
I'm not sure if this will work for our unique procurement process. Can you provide any customization options?

We understand that every business is unique, and we offer customized solutions to fit your specific needs. We'll work with you to understand your requirements and develop a tailored solution that meets your needs.
What kind of ROI can we expect from implementing Whatfix?

We've seen our clients achieve significant ROI from implementing our platform. On average, our clients see a 3-6 month payback period on their investment. For example, XYZ Hotels saw a 30% reduction in training time and a 25% increase in user productivity. We believe Whatfix can provide similar benefits for your organization.
We're looking to implement a solution within the next 3 months. Can you work with our timeline?
Absolutely. We're confident that we can implement Whatfix within your timeline. We'll work closely with your team to ensure a smooth implementation process and meet your deadline.
Our budget for this project is $100,000. Can you provide a pricing plan that fits within our budget?

Based on your requirements, I believe our Flat Fee + User License Fees model would be the best fit. We can provide a customized plan that fits within your budget of $100,000. Would you like me to provide a detailed pricing proposal?
Yes, please. We'd also like to know how Whatfix can help us achieve our KPIs, such as improved user adoption and increased productivity.

We're confident that Whatfix can help you achieve your KPIs. Our platform is designed to improve user adoption and increase productivity. We've seen significant improvements in these areas with our existing customers. We'll work with you to develop a success plan that meets your KPIs and provides a strong ROI.
Our company's financial priority is to increase revenue and reduce costs. Can you explain how Whatfix can help us achieve these goals?

We believe Whatfix can help you achieve your financial goals by reducing costs associated with manual tasks and increasing revenue through improved productivity and efficiency. Our platform is designed to provide a strong ROI, and we're confident that it can help you achieve your financial goals.

I'd like to summarize the discussion we had today. We've discussed our pricing models, and I believe our Flat Fee + User License Fees model would be the best fit for your organization. We've also addressed your concerns around integration, customization, and ROI. We're confident that Whatfix can help you achieve your KPIs and financial goals. Would you like to move forward with a detailed pricing proposal?
Yes, please. We're interested in moving forward with Whatfix.

Great! I'll send over a detailed pricing proposal by the end of the week. We can schedule a follow-up call to discuss any questions you may have and finalize the implementation plan. Thank you for your time today, and I look forward to working with you.

messages.content: Hello, everyone. Thank you for taking the time to discuss the implementation of Whatfix today. I understand that we've had a thorough discussion about the product and its features during our previous calls. I'll make sure to address any concerns you might have.
Hi. Yeah, we've had a good discussion, but I still have some final concerns. How will Whatfix integrate with our existing systems and workflows?

That's a great question. I'd like to assure you that our platform has been designed to integrate seamlessly with your existing systems. We've had success with similar integrations in the past, and I'm confident that we can make it work for you as well. Can I offer you a customized plan that addresses your specific integration needs?

I'm not sure if this will work for our unique procurement process. We have multiple stakeholders involved, and it's a complex process. How can you ensure that Whatfix will adapt to our specific needs?

I understand your concerns, and I'd like to address them. We've worked with companies that have unique processes, and we've been able to adapt our platform to fit their needs. We offer customized solutions, and I'm confident that we can do the same for you. I'd like to propose a customized plan that addresses your specific needs and adapts to your unique procurement process.
What kind of ROI can we expect from implementing Whatfix? We need to make sure that it's worth the investment.

We've seen our clients achieve significant ROI from implementing our platform. On average, our clients see a 3-6 month payback period on their investment. In fact, XYZ Hotels, one of our clients, saw a 30% reduction in training time and a 25% increase in user productivity. I'm confident that we can help you achieve similar results.

That sounds promising. But we need to discuss the contract terms and procurement concerns. We have a budget constraint of $100,000, and we need to ensure that the implementation happens within the next 3 months.

I understand your constraints, and I'm happy to work with you to find a solution that fits within your budget. I can offer you a flat fee + user license fees model, which I believe will be the most cost-effective for you. Additionally, I can provide you with a customized plan that ensures a smooth and efficient implementation process within the next 3 months. Can I propose a discount of 10% on the total cost to show our commitment to making this work for you?
That sounds like a good proposal. But we still need to discuss the procurement concerns. We have a thorough vendor approval process, and we need to ensure that Whatfix meets our requirements.

I completely understand. I'd be happy to provide you with all the necessary information and support to ensure that we meet your procurement requirements. We've worked with similar companies in the past, and we're confident that we can meet your expectations. I can also provide you with a dedicated customer success manager who will ensure a smooth implementation process and address any concerns you might have.
Okay, I think we've covered everything. What are the next steps?

I'm glad we could address your concerns. The next steps would be to finalize the contract and implementation plan. I'll send over a customized proposal that outlines the scope, timeline, and pricing. If everything looks good to you, we can move forward with the implementation. Does that sound good to you?
That sounds good to me. Thank you for addressing our concerns and providing us with a customized solution.
You're welcome. I'm confident that we can make this work for you, and I'm looking forward to sending over the proposal. Thank you for your time today, and I'll talk to you soon.
